result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamarr A Sumlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamarr A Sumlin in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Lamarr A Sumlin in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Ramerro M.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 61 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim:  Lashell M, the location of 2848 W. Wisconsin Ave. #205.  Contact with Ramerro M. at the probation agent's discretion.  
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $1000.00 to be paid to Ramerro M.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letter on behalf of the defendant, received and filed.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Lamarr A Sumlin in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Lamarr A Sumlin in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant sworn. 

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Letter on behalf of the defendant, filed.
dated 8/11/2016 from Taylor E on behalf of the defendant, received and filed

Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Letter on behalf of the defendant, received and filed.

css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lashell M.; Ramerro M. or their residences

Defendant Lamarr A Sumlin in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Lamarr A Sumlin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
